page.title: 12CHANGE West Forres
page.content: Over the years there have been many changes in the way of life on the Altyre Estate,the most striking of these being the decrease in the number of estate workers employed.In the 1950s there were 25 men employedin forestry work,18 estate workers,5 gardeners and 8 gamekeepers.Today there are only 3 foresters,1 part time gardener and 1 gamekeeper.Tractors,ploughs,cultivator s and machinery for loading wood have led to fewer men being needed.Before the Second World War there were no water supplies to the houses,buses to town ran once a week and several vans selling food and goods called regularly.Wages were paid once a month and workers had a five and a half day week and two days holiday a year.Conditions are much better but people are less contented.
